currentDoc:
Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If pe

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly thin

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare.

I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly think that many people are a threat because of th

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly think that many people are a threat because of thing they have experienced. For them to care more about animals isn't wrong.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly think that many people are a threat because of thing they have experienced. For them to care more about animals isn't wrong. 
There are many explanations for why it's NOT wrong to focus on an

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly think that many people are a threat because of thing they have experienced. For them to care more about animals isn't wrong. 
There are many explanations for why it's NOT wrong to focus on animal welfare even when h

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

There are many explanations for why it's NOT wrong to focus on animal welfare even when humans suffer, but most

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly think that many people are a threat because of thing they have experienced. For them to care more about animals isn't wrong. 
There are many explanations for why it's NOT wrong to focus on animal welfare even when humans suffer, but most importantly if people D

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly think that many people are a threat because of thing they have experienced. For them to care more about animals isn't wrong. 
There are many explanations for why it's NOT wrong to focus on animal welfare even when humans suffer, but most importantly if people don't even care ab

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people tend to be more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than humans sometimes because, let's face it; humans can be downright mean and despicable. Its easy to feel sorry for a dog who just wants to be loved, but it can be much harder to feel compassion for a person if you are someone who has seen humans do cruel and unspeakable things to each other. I don't think this is wrong and it's in our nature to feel the way that we feel. 
I know that humans are suffering and I do think we should care about that. However, I think that we should care about the suffering of all living creatures and I don't think that caring for animals does anything to take away from caring for humans since it's common to care for both. So no, the amount of human suffering that exists does not make it wrong to focus on animal welfare. 
If a person has been harmed by another person a lot in his or her life then I can imagine how their trusted animal companion would be held in a higher regard than a person, who they know might actually hurt them. Some people wrongly think that many people are a threat because of thing they have experienced. For them to care more about animals isn't wrong.
